result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

* Goes with 20CT248 & 21CM572
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Steven Johnson Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ali M Mahmood appeared by video for Michael Steven Johnson Jr. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
